answers.answer: I had one test done at 14weeks and the results were negative. I will be taking another test at 28 weeks. The OB told me that they always do that. I will be relive if I get it done because I have a family history of diabetes.
I did one at 8 weeks because I was overweight to start, and had to do it again at 28 weeks.
I only had one. And I was overweight with my first and this pregnancy.
I only did one. I am overweight I did mine at 26 weeks

I had it done 4 times! First at 10 weeks cause of family history, then at 16 weeks cause of glucose on urine, failed and had to do the 3 hr!  Then the last one on Tuesday at 28 weeks, and thank god I passed all of them!! And the one I failed was because I had eaten very sugary cereal right before the test!

Without predisposing factors, typically done once at 26-28 weeks. However, GDM can develop later and it would possibly with a large fetal abdominal circumference. I have seen patients retested at 36 weeks. A fetus with an accelerated AC as a result of GDM can develop diabetic fetopathy and go hypoglycemic after birth.
^ thank you for the detailed answer :)

Yes ypu can takebt more than once becuase u can get the diabetes later in pregnancy. Just because u didnt have it earlier doesnt mean u cant get it later on. Its more common to get it later in pregnancy too.
I had one done in the beginning of my pregnancy because I'm overweight and I had another one done at 27 weeks but they were supposed to do it again at 24 weeks. .
I had one at 12 weeks and one at 24. Passed both
I had one in begining of preg n one jus a cuple days ago. Diabetes runs in my family. Passed first time but not ths time :(

question: Did any of you ladies doctors have you take the gestational diabetes test twice? Mine did but I thought you were only supposed to get that done once? Especially if  the results came back saying I was fine & had no diabetes
title: gestational diabetes test TWICE??
